intro: Polycarpaea garuensis, commonly known as the Garuensis polycarpaea, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
